titleStmt.title: The history of Arbasto King of Denmarke Describing the anatomy of fortune, his loue to faire Doralicia. Wherein gentlemen may finde pleasant conceits to purge melancholy, and perfect counsell to preuent mis-fortune. By Robert Green, Master of Art. Wherevnto is added a louely poem of Pyramus and Thisbe.
Arbasto
titleStmt.author: Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592.

titleStmt.author: Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592.
Gale, Dunstan. Pyramus and Thisbe. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I. B[eale] for Roger Iackson, and are to be sold at his shop neere Fleet Conduit,

notesStmt.note: "Pyramus and Thisbe" by Dunstan Gale, in verse, has separate dated title page and register. It is lacking in two of the three copies known, and was also published separately (STC 11527).
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
